comment: She was a great professor, exams were easy if you read the book and open note. Weekly homework that is quick to get through and really helps on the exams.

She is a good professor but the exams were hard. You have to study hard and read the textbook. The exams are lockdown browser but open note. Extra credit if you come to class and others don't show up.
Professor Littles did a great job at giving us exactly what we needed to succeed and she made sure to give us opportunities to make up missed work.

Lectures are not very helpful considering she is just reading the textbook verbatim however, you can do well in this class by simply completing assignments. Not much studying is required because the exams are open note and she sends out a study guide the night before with all of the concepts needed. She never responds to emails!!

This class is good if you just want an easy A. Attendance isn't mandatory, but she will take it if there are not a lot of students in class and count it as extra credit. Her lectures are just her reading the textbook. Her tests are all open note and you have the whole day to take them online. She also gives you multiple attempts on the homework.

Tons of Connect homework. TONS. Tests are online, (Lockdown w/ Webcam) and are extremely long with 5 multiple choice answers (ie. ABCDE). And the answers are meant to trick you. They're hard. She is rude if you seek help, and ISNT REACHABLE. She barely responds via email The only thing giving her a 2 is the lenient grade policy she has. DONT TAKE.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Super funny and gives lots of examples in class to make sense of the concepts. Make sure to study the textbook for the tests, her powerpoints will not be enough. We only get two homework assignments each week so it's not a terrible amount of homework. Tip; read the textbook and create a quizlet with terms as you read, this has been key to pass.
